channel.title: H is for joy
channel.description:
A documentary series about the nature of drug addiction, the current status of addiction, and various programs of prevention and treatment. Participants in the series include Dr. Rafael S. Gamso; Meyer Diskind of New York State Board of Parole; and Joseph Fiedoral, a Chicago policeman.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Treatment programs, part 4
item.description: This program, the fourth of six parts about treatment programs for addicts, features Meyer Diskind on the Special Narcotics project of the New York State Board of Parole.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Narcotic education
item.description: This program asks what should we teach our children about addiction and what is being taught now? Chicago public school officials and Malachi Harney of Illinois Narcotic Control Division are guests.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Marijuana
item.description: This program focuses on marijuana abuse. Retired Chicago policeman Joseph Fiedoral is a guest.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Addiction: East coast & midwest
item.description: In this program, agents George Gaffney and Albert Cook describe addiction problems in New York and Ohio. Also, why it is so difficult to apprehend the "big traffickers."
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Narcotics and the law, continued.
item.description: In this program, the second of three parts, Paul J. Maton, technical advisor to the Illinois Division of Narcotic Control, speaks about narcotic laws there.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Treatment programs, part 1
item.description: This program, the first of six parts about treatment programs for addicts, introduces the listener to the team therapy approach of Riverside Hospital in New York City, the only addiction-treatment U.S. hospital for under-21 addicts. Features Dr. Rafael Gamso.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Addiction: International status
item.description: In this program, Commissioner Harry Anslinger tells of international control of narcotics distribution. Also: Federal Narcotics Agent Howard Chappell of Los Angeles.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Sociological analysis, part 1
item.description: In this program, the first of three parts, Solomon Kobrin and Harold Finestone of Chicago's Institute for Juvenile Research speak of a sociological approach to an understanding of addiction.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Treatment programs, part 2
item.description: This program, the second of six parts about treatment programs for addicts, introduces the listener to the team therapy approach of Riverside Hospital in New York City, the only addiction-treatment U.S. hospital for under-21 addicts. Features Dr. Rafael Gamso.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Addiction: Midwest status
item.description: In this program, George Belk of the Federal Narcotics Bureau comments on addiction status in Chicago and its surrounding area. Commissioner Anslinger speaks of civic cooperation.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Sociological analysis, part 2
item.description: In this program, the second of three parts, Solomon Kobrin and Harold Finestone of Chicago's Institute for Juvenile Research speak of a sociological approach to an understanding of addiction.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Addiction: West and east coast
item.description: In this program, Commissioner Anslinger and two of his agents, Howard Chappell and George Gaffney, give vivid picture of addiction status on the coasts.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: An addict speaks, part 1
item.description: In this program, the first of two parts, a drug addict of long standing relates how he got started using drugs, with his introduction to marijuana, opium smoking and the use of cocaine.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Treatment programs, part 5
item.description: This program, the fifth of six parts about treatment programs for addicts, explores the work of St. Leonard's House, a half-way house for ex-prisoners in Chicago. Father James G. Jones speaks in favor of legalization of narcotics.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Supply
item.description: In this program, the transportation of one pound of heroin from its source to the veins of the addict is hypothetically described. The Federal Narcotics Commissioner talks briefly about supply.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: International & federal narcotic laws
item.description: In this program, the first of three parts. District Supervisor George Belk of the Federal Narcotics Bureau outlines international and federal narcotics laws.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Introduction to the problem
item.description: This program presents listeners with an introduction to the problem of drug addiction.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Treatment programs, part 6
item.description: This program, the sixth of six parts about treatment programs for addicts, presents an addict, a prison chaplain and director of a non-profit religious organization treating addicts giving their views concerning religious conversion.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Narcotics and the law, continued.
item.description: In this program, the third of three parts, Paul J. Maton returns to speak against irrational critics of the law. A junkie tells his opinion of laws' effectiveness. Current news items included.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Sociological analysis, part 3
item.description: In this program, the third of three parts, Solomon Kobrin and Harold Finestone of Chicago's Institute for Juvenile Research speak of a sociological approach to an understanding of addiction.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Cocaine and heroin
item.description: This program focuses on cocaine and heroin. Dr. Rafael Gamso of Riverside Hospital in New York describes drugs used by most addicts and comments on reasons for addiction.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Treatment programs, part 3
item.description: This program, the third of six parts about treatment programs for addicts, introduces the listener to the team therapy approach of Riverside Hospital in New York City, the only addiction-treatment U.S. hospital for under-21 addicts. Features Dr. Rafael Gamso.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: An addict speaks, part 2
item.description: In this program, the second of two parts, a longtime drug addict vividly describes his daily life on the street as a junkie.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Summary
item.description: In this program, Kenneth Jones, a former addict and now director of the Christian Anti-Narcotic Association, summarizes matter of religious therapy. Then, the whole scope of the series is summarized.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Heroin, morphine, and other opiates
item.description: In this program, Joseph Fiedoral tells how use of marijuana often leads to use of heroin and other opiates. Dr. Rafael Gamso discusses other drugs made from opium.
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health

item.title: Withdrawal
item.description: This program focuses on what happens to an addict when he simply cannot get his 'stuff.' Dr. Rafael Gamso is a guest, followed by a junkie who tells what it feels like to go 'cold turkey.'
item.dc:creator: Vanetta, Ed
item.dc:subject: Psychology & Mental Health
